alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 4:54AM MST until March 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. For Oak Creek near Cornville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. At 12.0 feet, Significant flooding of RV park near Page Springs Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM MST Thursday the stage was 11.6 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 AM MST Thursday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 11.6 feet early this morning and then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 03/02/2015. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 11.6 Thu 4 am MST 5.8 4.6 4.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
